SEARCH
Package model

Class Door

java.lang.Object
model.Door
All Implemented Interfaces:
EffectOnPlayer
public class Door extends Object implements EffectOnPlayer
This represents the Door that the player can interact (by unlocking using a key) in the game

Each door is compatible with a specific key and so the player can only enter the door if the player has a key compatible with the door

Version:
1.0
Author:
Anton Galido

  • Constructor Details

    • Door

      public Door(int xPosition, int yPosition, String color, char symbol)
      Constructs a new door object with a specified coordinate, color and symbol
      Parameters:
      xPosition - the x coordinate of the Door
      yPosition - the y coordinate of the Door
      color - the represented color of the door
      symbol - the symbol or character representing the door in the map

  • Method Details

    • canPlayerEnter

      public boolean canPlayerEnter(Player player)
      Checks if the player can enter through the door.

      The player can enter through the door if they have the proper key or if it's already unlocked.

      pre-condition: player object exists and has a valid inventory post-condition: returns true if door is unlocked or player has a key, false otherwise
      Parameters:
      player - the player who is attempting to enter the door
      Returns:
      true if player can enter, false otherwise

    • onPlayerEnter

      public void onPlayerEnter(Player player, Maps map)
      Handles what happens once player enters the door.

      If the player has the compatible key, they enter as the door unlocks, then the door tile will be replaced by a blank tile.

      pre-condition: player and map objects exist post-condition: if player can enter, door is unlocked, key is consumed, and is replaced with blank tile
      Specified by:
      onPlayerEnter in interface EffectOnPlayer
      Parameters:
      player - the player who interacts with the door
      map - the map where the door resides
